March 3, 1958
Mr. Archie M. Greer
Supervisor of Broadcasting
WOUB
Ohio University
Athens, Ohio
Dear Mr. Greer;
1 received the report which you submitted on your NAEB-
aided research project and it has been placed in the files
of the Research Committee. I feel that these reports, which
have been aided by the NAEB, should be published where the
membership of the organization may receive the benefits which
may accrue from knowledge of the results. Therefore, I would
strongly suggest that this be written up for the NAEB Journal.
If you are not successful in getting it published there, we
will see about the possibility of its distribution as part of
the NAEB Factsheet service. I believe that it would receive
a better reading, however •• more widespread — in the Journal.
I would offer two suggestions for the rewrite which you
do for publication. It is difficult to evaluate the meaning
of the strong rise in llstenershlp after your AM outlet went
on the air without knowing the date at which it did. You tell
us when the wired-wireless went on the air, when FM went on
the air, but neglect the specific AM date. If your survey
took place immediately after this first station in the com¬
munity went on, we could certainly hypothesize an atypical
listening pattern. You owe it to the reader to give him the
specific information which will allow him to evaluate your
results and conclusions.
The second suggestion would be a clarification of item 1
on page 10. X have not had an opportunity to check that v56
issue of Sponsor but aren't their figures the percentage of the
population who listen at some time during the evening. Your
figures more nearly approach the percentage having sets on at
any one time. If the former is so (on the Sponsor figures)
this could explain your underestimate.
